Yoruba: Mínísítà fún àjọ tó ń mójútó ètò ọmọnìyàn, ìjàm̀bá pàjáwìrì àti ìdàgbàsókè àyíká lorilẹ èdè Nàìjíríà, ọ̀dọ̀ àjọ tó ń mójútó ètò ọmọnìyàn, ìjàm̀bá pàjáwìrì àti ìdàgbàsókè àyíká , Sadiya Umar Farouq  ṣàlàyé pé ètò tí ìrànwọ́ owó tí àwọn ń ṣe ọ̀hun wà lára ìlérí tí ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari ṣe láti pèsè ètò ìrànwọ́ lásìkò ìgbélé lọ́nà àtidẹ́kun ààrùn Covid-19.

English: The conditional cash transfer payments in Anambra State, South Eastern Nigeria started with Anyamelum LGA (Wards Anaku 1 & 2; Omor 1 & 2; Umerum Umumbo; Igbakwu; Ifite Ogwari 1 & 2; Umueje and Omasi).
Yoruba: Ètò ìrànwọ́ náà wáyé ní ìpínlẹ̀  Anambra , ní ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ Anyamelum  (Wọọdu Anaku 1 & 2; Omor 1 & 2; Umerum Umumbo; Igbakwu; Ifite Ogwari 1 & 2; Umueje ati Omasi).

English: Similar payments to more beneficiaries of the programme were carried out in three centers of Wamba East, Wayo and Nakere in Nasarawa State, North Central Nigeria.
Yoruba: Ètò ìrànwọ́ owó ọ̀hún tún wáyé ní àwọn ibi mẹ́ta kan ní Wamba, Wayo àti Nakere ní ìpínlẹ́ Nasarawa ,tó jẹ́ ààrin gbùngbùn orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà.

English: Also payments were made in eleven of the 34 local government areas of Katina State.
Yoruba: Bákan náà, wọ̣n tún rí ìrànwọ́ owó yìí gba ní ìjọ̣ba ìbílẹ̀ mẹ́tàlélọ́gbọ̀n ní ìpínlẹ̀ Katsina.

English: The local government areas are Bakori, Bindawa, Baure, Batagarawa, Dandume and Ingawa,  Kaita, Mani, Musawa, Rimi and Kankara.
Yoruba: Àwọn ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ náà ni Bakori, Bindawa, Baure, Batagarawa, Dandume, Ingawa, Kaita, Mani, Musawa, Rimi ati Kankara.

English: --- COVID-19: President Buhari directs prompt payment of salaries
Yoruba: --- COVID-19: Ẹ máa san owó oṣù àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ lásìkò – ààrẹ Buhari

English: President Muhammadu Buhari has directed the Ministry of Finance and National Planning to promptly pay salaries of workers in the country.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ Nàìjíríà, Muhammadu Buhari ti pàṣẹ fún àjọ amojuto ètò ìnáwó àti ètò ìlànà lórílèèdè láti máa sanwó oṣù àwọn òṣìṣẹ́.

English: He gave the directive during a meeting with the Presidential Committee on the Impact of COVID-19 on the Nigerian economy at the Presidential Villa, Abuja on Thursday.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ sọ̀rọ̀ yìí nílé ààrẹ tó wà nílùú Àbújá lásìkò tó ń ṣèpàdé pẹ̣̀lú ìgbìmọ̀ ààrẹ tó ń mójútó ààrùn COVID-19, nípa ètò ọrọ̀ ajé orílẹ̀èdè yìí.

English: The President also directed the ministry to ensure that critical infrastructure like roads and rails are protected and as much as possible, use local inputs so that the country retains value within its economy.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ tún wá pàṣẹ fún àjọ ọ̣̀hún láti mójútó ètò amáyédẹrùn bíi àwọn ojú pópó ọkọ̀ àti ojú ọkọ̀ irin, kí wọ́n ṣì máa ṣe àmúlò àwọn irinsẹ́ orílẹ̀ èdè yìí.

English: Chairman of the committee and Minister of Finance, Budget and National Planning, Zainab Ahmed, said these while fielding questions from State House Correspondents after the meeting.
Yoruba: Alága ìgbìmọ̀ ọ̀hún, mínísítà fún ètò ìnáwó, ìsúná àti ìlànà orílẹ̀èdè, Zainab Ahmed, lásìkò tó ń báwọn akọ̀ròyìn ilé ààrẹ sọ̀rọ̀, lẹ́yìn ìpàdé náà.

English: Ahmed who heads the presidential committee stated that ”the President further directed the committee to ensure that measures that protect the poor and the vulnerable are in place.”
Yoruba: Ahmed alága ìgbìmọ̀ náà ní "Ààrẹ tún pàsẹ pé kí ìgbìmọ̀ náà rí i pé wọ́n ṣètò ìlànà tí yóò leè dáàbò bò àwọn akús̩è̩é̩ àti abarapá láwùjọ. "

English: Briefing She told Journalists that the committee briefed the President on current happenings around the world due to COVID-19 and the impact on the nation’s economy.
Yoruba: Nínú àlàyé rè̩ sí àwo̩n akò̩rò̩yìn, ó nígbìmò̩ náà ti so̩ ìs̩è̩lè̩ ló̩wó̩ló̩wó̩ káàkiri àgbáyé fún ààre̩ nítorí COVID-19 àti ipa tó ní ló̩rò̩ jé wa.

English: She said: “Well, he has directed that we should make sure that salaries are paid, make critical infrastructures like roads, rails are protected, as much as possible use local inputs so that we retain value within our economy.
Yoruba: Ó ní, “lóòótó ni Ààre̩ ti ní kí wó̩n sanwó os̩ù àwo̩n òs̩ìs̩é̩, kí wó̩n sì mójútó àwo̩n ètò amáyéde̩rùn bíi àwo̩n ojú pópó o̩kò̩, àti ojú o̩kò̩ irin kí wó̩n sì s̩àmúlò irins̩é̩ orílèèdè yìí

English: And also make sure that we put in place measures that protect the poor and the vulnerable.”
Yoruba: Kí iyì wa má baà so̩nù. Bákan náà, kí wó̩n s̩ètò ìrò̩rùn fún aláìní àti abarapá láwùjo̩.

English: On the purpose of the meeting, she said, “This meeting was just to brief Mr. President as the situation we are in keeps evolving on a daily basis.
Yoruba: Lórí ìdí abájo̩ ìpàdé náà, ó ní, “èrèdí ìpàdé náà ni láti sò̩rò̩ s̩ókí fún ààre̩ lórí bí ìs̩è̩lè̩ àsìkò yìí s̩e ń gbóhun tuntun yo̩ lójoojúmó̩.

English: As the health crisis gradually expands, affecting States and also the lockdown that has been ordered to help curtail expansion of the health crisis.
Yoruba: Bí ìpèníjà ìlera s̩e ń gbòòrò si, ó sì ń s̩àkóbá fún ìpínlè̩ gbogbo àti ìgbélé tó wà láti kápa gbígbòòrò ìpèníjà ìlera yìí.

English: “The consequences of the lockdown are the additional slowing down of the economy and the measures that we need to take to mitigate the negative consequences of the slow trade and businesses.”
Yoruba: “Ìjìyà ìgbélé ni mímú ò̩rò̩ ajé náà fà bí ìgbín àti ìgbésè̩ tí ó ye̩ ní gbígbé láti lè dènà okùnfà búburú lórí fífà bíi ìgbín àwo̩n o̩jà òun òkòwò.”

English: Another member of the committee, the Minister of State Petroleum Resources, Timipre Sylva, said the economy is not in the best of shapes, due to COVID-19 and oil prices are collapsing every day, hence the need for the President to be constantly briefed.
Yoruba: Ọ̀kan lára ìgbìmọ̀ ọ̀hún, ìye̩n mínísítà ìpínlẹ̀ fún ètò epo rọ̀bì lórílẹ̀èdè yìí, Timipre Sylva, ní ètò ọrọ̀ ajé orílẹ̀ èdè yìí kò fararọ nítorí ààrùn COVID-19, àti pé, owó epo ń jábó̩ lójoojúmó̩, èyí ló s̩e okùnfà ìso̩nís̩ókí fún ààre̩ lóòrèkóòrè.

English: The Governor of the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN), Godwin Emefiele, said the economy is not looking as simple as everybody thought it would be.
Yoruba: Aláákóso ilé-ìfowópamọ́ tìjọba àpapọ̀ (CBN), Godwin Emefiele, ní ètò ọ̣rọ̀ ajé orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà kò rẹ́ẹ́rìń rárá yàtọ̀ sí báwọn ènìyàn ṣe rò ó lọ́kàn.

English: He said: “The global economy naturally like we all know at this time will naturally suffer growth problems and may even lead to recession globally.
Yoruba: Ó ní,”ètò o̩rò̩ ajé lágbàáyé gan-an, báa s̩e mò̩, yóò jìyà àwo̩n ìs̩òro ìdàgbàsókè ó sì tún lè mú àkùdé bá ètò o̩rò̩ ajé lágbàáyé.

English: So, we are trying to see what we can do as a country to rescue our own situation so we don’t go the direction many will go.
Yoruba: Nítorí náà, à ń gbìyànjú láti rí ohun tá lè s̩e gé̩gé̩ bíi orílèèdè láti borí ìs̩òro ló̩wó̩ló̩wó̩ ká má ba ko̩rí só̩nà àìda tó̩pò̩ lo̩.

English: “It is not going to be easy but we can only assure our people that we are on top of it and that we will resolve it and Nigerians will still be better for it.”
Yoruba: “Kò ní ro̩rùn s̩ùgbó̩n a kàn le fi da àwo̩n ènìyàn wa lójú pé à ń s̩is̩é̩ gan-an lórí rè̩ àti pé a óò wa ojútùú si, àwo̩n o̩mo̩ orílè̩-èdè Nàìjíríà á sì s̩e rere síi.

English: Other members of the committee are the Minister of State, Budget and National Planning, Clement Agba and the Group Managing Director of the Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation (NNPC), Mela Kyari.
Yoruba: Àwọn tó wà níbi ìgbìmọ̀ ọ̀hún náà ni mínísítà ìpínlẹ̀ fún ètò ìsúná àti ètò ìlànà orílẹ̀ èdè, Clement Àgbà àti aláà́kóso ilé-iṣẹ́ epo rọ̀bì (NNPC), Mela Kyari.

English: --- Customs boss commends officers on essential duties
Yoruba: --- Alákóso àwọn asọ́bodè gbósùbà fún àwọn òsìsẹ́ rẹ̀

English: The Comptroller-General of the Nigeria Customs, Colonel Hameed Ali has commended Officers and Men of the service who are on essential duties despite the risks in their respective locations as lockdown entered day three.
Yoruba: Alákóso àwọn asọ́bodè lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà ti gbósùbà fún àwọn òṣìsẹ́ rẹ̀ bí wọ́n ṣe fakọyọ àti ìwà akínkanjú tí wọ́n ń hù lásìkò ti òfin ìgbélé láti dẹ́kun ààrùn Corona ti wọ ọjọ́ mẹ́ta báyìí.

English: Mr Ali said reports reaching the Headquarters from the Commands indicate that, Customs operatives have been rising to the challenge of their professional calling by keeping the Seaports functional.
Yoruba: Ọ̀gbẹ́ni Àlí ní àwọn ìròyìn tí òun ń gbọ́ nípa àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ rẹ̀ nípa ìwà akínkanjú tí wọ́n ń hù lásìkò ìpèníjà tó ń dojúkọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà nípasẹ̀ ààrùn Corona, pàápàá jùlọ láti dáàbò bo àwọn ibùdó ọkọ̀ ojú omi.

English: He advised the operatives to maintain person to person distancing, wash hands regularly, sanitise their hands and comply with all other recommendations by medical experts.
Yoruba: Ó wá rọ àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ rẹ̀ láti máa tẹ̀lé ìlànà tí àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ ètò ìlera là sílẹ̀ nípa fífọ ọwọ́ wọn, yíyẹra fún àwọn ènìyàn  àti nípa lílo ọsẹ a-pa kòkòrò lóòrè-kóòrè.

English: He prayed for the quick recovery for those undergoing COVID-19 treatment and for the Almighty God to heal Nigeria and the world generally.
Yoruba: Ó wá gbàdúrà pé kí Ọlọ́run wo àwọn tí ààrùn COVID-19 mú fún ìwòsàn kíákíá, kí Ọlọ́run sì tún wo orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà  àti àgbáyé sàn.

English: --- COVID-19 lockdown: Nigeria Armed Forces denounces misleading viral videos
Yoruba: --- COVID-19: ilé-iṣẹ́ ológun ní irọ̣́ ni fídíò tí wọ́n ń gbé káàkiri

English: The Nigeria Defence Headquarters on Wednesday, said its attention has been drawn to some video clips circulating in the media with the intention of deliberately smearing the image of the Nigeria Army.
Yoruba: Ilé-iṣẹ́ ológun ti ní irọ́ ni fídíò tí àwọn ènìyàn ń gbé káàkiri lórí ẹ̀rọ ayélujára àti ní ilé-iṣẹ́ ìròyìn láti ba ilé-isẹ́ ọ̀hún lórúkọ jẹ́.

English: The Coordinator, Defence Media Operations, Major General John Enenche stated that the videos which were old clips of past incidences that took place in 2012 and 2013 respectively, were being used by some mischievous elements to mislead the public about military engagement towards lockdown declared by the Federal Government in some states to curtail the spread of COVID-19.
Yoruba: Olùdarí ẹ̀ka ìròyìn àti ìkéde fún ilé-isẹ́ náà, ọ̀gágun John Enenche ló sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lọ́jọ́rú pé ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ tó wà nínú fídíò tí àwọn ènìyàn ń gbé káàkiri náà wáyé lọ́dún 2012 àti 2013, ní èyí tí àwọn ẹni ibi ń lò lásìkò tí ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè yìí pàṣẹ pé kí àwọn ọmọ ogun wà lára àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ elétò ààbò láti ràn wọ́n lọ́wọ́ lásìkò òfin ìgbélé, láti dẹ́kun ìtànkálẹ̀ ààrùn COVID-19.

English: According to John Enenche, the Nigerian Armed Forces sees those clips as calculated attempts to tarnish its professional integrity.
Yoruba: Ọ̀gágun John Enenche ni  Mo wá rọ gbogbo àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà láti rí  fídíò tí wọ́n ń gbé káàkiri gẹ́gẹ́ bí iṣẹ́ ọwọ́ àwọn ẹni ibi láti ba ilé-isẹ́ ológun lórúkọ jẹ́.

English: The Armed Forces of Nigeria remains undaunted and would not be distracted from their constitutional role in ensuring the protection of Nigeria’s territorial integrity and securing the lives and property of the general public.
Yoruba: Ilé-iṣẹ́ ológun kò ní ká à árẹ̀ nípa ojúṣe rẹ̀ láti máa tẹ́lẹ̀ òfin orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà áti láti máa dáàbò bo àwọn omọ orílẹ̀ èdè yìí.

English: --- COVID-19: Nigeria confirms 23 new cases
Yoruba: --- COVID-19: Àwọn mẹ́tàlélógún(23) mìíràn tún jẹyọ lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà

English: Nigeria has confirmed 23 new cases of the novel coronavirus also known as COVID-19.
Yoruba: Àwọn mẹ́tàlélógún (23) mìíràn tó jẹ́ ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà ni wọ́n tún ní ààrùn Corona, (COVID-19) báyìí.

English: The new cases were confirmed in Lagos, FCT, Akwa Ibom, Kaduna and Bauchi.
Yoruba: Àwọn kan tó ní ààrùn Corona tún jẹyọ ní ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó, ìlú Àbújá, Akwa Ibom, Kaduna ati Bauchi.

English: According to Nigerian Centre for Disease Control, NCDC, 9 of the cases were confirmed in Lagos, 7 in the FCT, 5 in Akwa Ibom, 1 in Kaduna and 1 in Bauchi State.
Yoruba: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí  àjọ tó ń gbógun tí ààrùn kòkòrò (Nigerian Centre for Disease Control, NCDC,)ṣe sọ pé , wọ́n rí mẹ́sàn án( 9) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó,méje (7)ní ìlú Àbújá, FCT, márùn ún (5) ní ìpínlẹ̀  Akwa Ibom, ẹyọ kan (1) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Kàdúná àti ẹyọ kan (1) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Bauchi.

English: This brings the total confirmed cases of Coronavirus in Nigeria to 174 with nine discharged and two deaths.
Yoruba: Gbogbo àwọn tó ti ní ààrùn Corona lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà wá jẹ́ mẹ́rìnléláàdọ́sàn án (174) tí àwọn mẹ́sàn án yege àti àwọn méjì sì ti gbẹ́mì  mìì.

English: --- COVID-19: See as the federal capital territory was so quite
Yoruba: --- COVID-19: Ẹ wo ìlú Àbújá bó se pa lọ́lọ́

English: If it was a priest or an herbalist that gave a warning to all Nigerians that a disease is coming that will cause everybody to sit at home.
Yoruba: Tó bá jẹ́ pé al̀ùfáà tàbí babaláwo tó mọfá-mọ̀pẹ̀lẹ̀ ló jíṣẹ́ fún gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà pé, ààrun kan ń bọ̀ , tí yóò jẹ́ kí tẹrú-tọmo, tonílé, tàlejò fìdìí mọ́lẹ́ wọn.

English: That a disease is coming that will cause business men to lock up their shops, that a disease is upcoming that will cause all that travel abroad because of headache or a brief illness refuse to go as usual, that they will sit at home, I’m so sure that all Nigerians will say the priest or the herbalist oracle does not a speak good thing.
Yoruba: Pé ààrùn kan ń bọ̀, tí yóò jẹ́ kí onísòwò ti sọ́ọ̀bù rẹ̀ pa, pé ààrùn kan ń bọ̀ tí yóò jẹ́ kí gbogbo àwọn tó máa ń tẹkọ̀ létí lọ sí ilẹ̀ òkèèrè nítorí ẹ̀fọ́rí tàbí àìsàn ráńpẹ́, kọ̀ láti sálọ bíi ìṣe wọn, pé wọn yóò  jókòó sílé , mo mọ̀ dájú pé gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà ni wọn yóò sọ pé kí  onítọ̀hún tàbí  fún babaláwo ọ̀hún pé ifá rẹ̀ kọ̀ fọ rere.

English: But, God does as he pleases him, COVID-19 disease called corona virus enter Nigeria, all of us kept quit, this virus that respect not the rich, poor, even the virus does not regard its source, China.
Yoruba: Àmọ́sá, ṣé bó ṣe wu olúwa ló ń ṣọlá, bó ṣe wu aṣẹ̀dàá  ló ń hùwà. Ààrùn COVID-19, ààrùn Corona wọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, gbogbo wa pa lọ́lọ́, ààrùn tí kò mọ olówó, tálákà, kó dà ààrùn tí kò mọ ibi tó ti wá, lórílẹ̀ èdè China.

English: One thing that is certain is that under any circumstances, Nigeria will succeed, Nigeria will be free from corona virus.
Yoruba: Ohun tí ó dá mi lójú ni pé, lábẹ́ bó ti wù kó rí, orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà yóò yege, orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà yóò bọ́ lọ́wọ́ ààrùn Corona.

English: Its compulsory that she be free from corona virus.
Yoruba: Ó di dandan ká bọ̣́ lọ́wọ́ ààrùn corona.

English: When corona will leave Nigeria, all Nigerians should learn one or two lessons from it that there is no one too big for God to arrest or capture.
Yoruba: Tí ààrùn Corona bá kúrò lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, ó yẹ kí gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ́ èdè Nàìjíríà kọ́ ọgbọ́n kan tàbí ìkejì níbẹ̀ pé, ẹni tí Ọlọ́run kò leè mú, ó dájú pé Ọlọ́run kò tíì dá onítọ̀hún.

English: We all in Nigeria should learn a lesson that there is no place like home.
Yoruba: Ó yẹ kí gbogbo wa lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà kọ́ ọgbọ́n pé, àjò kò dà bíi ilé, bí ọkọ̀ sì ròkun, rọ̀sà, ilé náà sì ni àbọ̀simi oko.

English: If we have equipped all our hospitals be it federal government hospitals  or the state government hospitals, all the health care center either small or the university teaching hospitals in Nigeria are standard, equivalent to all other hospitals abroad where the rich men go when they have a brief illness, if all  our hospitals are standard, the  problem and trouble of corona virus will be minimal in Nigeria.
Yoruba: Tó bá jẹ́ pé, a ti tún gbogbo ilé-ìwòsàn ìjọba yálá ti ìjọba àpapọ̀ tàbí ti ìpínlẹ̀, gbogbo ilé ìtọ́jú yálà alábọ́dé tàbí gbogbo àwọn ilé-ìwòsàn fásitì tó wà lórílẹ̀ èdè wa jẹ́ ojúlówó, jẹ́ èyí tó wà ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú gbogbo àwọn ilé-ìwòsàn tó wà nílẹ̀ òkèèrè, tí àwọn olówó wa máa ń sálọ lásìkò tí wọ́n bá ní àìsàn ráńpẹ́,tó bá jẹ́ pé  gbogbo àwọn ilé-ìwòsàn wa gbóuńjẹ fẹ́gbẹ́ gbàwobọ̀, ìwọ̀nba ni wàhálà àti ìdààmú tí ààrùn Corona kó wa sí lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà ìbá jẹ́.

English: My advise is that we should all come together in cooperation to bridge all the gaps in Nigeria either on our hospitals or our economy that our nation may grow.
Yoruba: Ìmọ̀ràn mi ni wí pé, kí gbogbo wa forí-korí, fikùn lukùn, nítorí pé àgbájọwọ́ la fi ń sọ̀yà, ọwọ́ kan kò gbẹ́rù dórí, Kí á gbìyànjú láti yanjú gbogbo àwọn kùdìẹ̀-kudiẹ tó wà lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí, yálà nílé ìwòsàn wa gbogbo, tàbí nípa ètò ọrọ̀ ajé, kí orílẹ̀ èdè wa leè gòkè àgbà.

English: A word is enough to the wise, thanks so much.
Yoruba: Àbọ̀ ọ̀rọ̀ là ń sọ fọ́mọlúàbí, tó bá dénú tán, yóò di odidi. ẹ sẹ́ púpọ̀.

English: --- Lockdown: the federal government start the sharing of twenty thousand naira in Abuja.
Yoruba: --- Títìpa: ìjọba àpapọ̀ bẹ̀rẹ̀ pínpín ogún ẹgbẹ̀rún náírà nílùú Àbújá

English: In a way to bring relief the people at the federal capital territory through the lockdown that the president Muhammadu Buhara announced, the government of Nigeria have starred the sharing of twenty thousand naira as palliative to those that lives in Kwali local government area.
Yoruba: Lọ́nà àtimú ìrọ̀rùn bá àwọn ènìyàn tó ń gbé nílùú Àbújá nípasẹ̀ òfin ìgbélé ti ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhara kéde rẹ̀, ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ń pín ogún ẹgbẹ̀rún náírà owó ìrànwọ́ fún àwọn tó ń gbé ní ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ Kwali.̀

English: The Minister of Humanitarian Affairs, Disaster Management and Social Development, Sadiya Umar Farouq  said this when giving out the cash on Wednesday morning.
Yoruba: Mínísítà fún ètò ọmọnìyàn, ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ pàjáwìrì àti ìdàgbàsókè àwùjọ, Hajiya Sadiya Umar Farouq ló sọ eléyìí lásìkò tí wọ́n ń pín owó ọ̣̀hún ní òwúrọ̀ ọjọ́rú.

English: The media house in Nigeria said, about one hundred and ninety people benefited from twenty thousand in Kwali local government area.
Yoruba: Ilé akéde Nàìjíríà sọ pé, àwọn ènìyàn tí iye wọn jẹ́ àádọ́wàá (190) ni wọ́n ti jẹ àǹfààní ogún ẹgbẹ̀rún (N20,000 ) ni ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ Kwali báyìí.

English: Farouk said the beneficiaries usually take a cash of five thousand monthly and were given twenty thousand naira for four month payment.
Yoruba: Hajiya Farouk ní àwọn ènìyàn tí wọ́n jẹ àǹfààní owó ọ̀hún ló jẹ́ pé ẹgbẹ̀rún ún márùn ún, ni wọ́n máa ń gbà tẹ́lẹ̀, lóṣooṣù, tí wọ́n wá fún wọn ní ogún ẹgbẹ̀rún lásìkò yìí fún owó oṣù mẹ́rin lẹ́èkan náà fún wọn.

English: She continued that five thousand people will benefit from the cash in Abuja.
Yoruba: Ó tẹ̀síwájú pé ẹgbẹ̀rún márùn ún àwọn ènìyàn ni yóò jẹ àǹfààní owó ìrànwọ́ ọ̀hún nílùú Àbújá.

English: --- Nigerian Government further reduces PMS price to N123.50
Yoruba: --- Owó epo ọkọ̀ ayọ́kẹ́lẹ́ tún ti dínkù sí N123.50

English: The Nigerian Government has approved the further reduction of Premium Motor Spirit (PMS) pump price to N123.50 per Litre.
Yoruba: Ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà tún ti fọwọ́sí àdínkù owó epo ọkọ̀ ayọ́kẹ́lẹ̀ lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà sí  náírà mẹ́tàlélọ́gọ́fà ààbọ̀ (N123. 50, per Litre) fún líta kan.

English: The Executive Secretary, Petroleum Products Pricing Regulatory Agency Abdulkadir Saidu, announced the reduction on Tuesday night,
Yoruba: Alákòóso àgbà fún ilé-iṣẹ́ tó ń ṣàmójútó owó orí epo ọkọ̀ ayọ́kẹ́lẹ́ lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà,(Petroleum Products Pricing Regulatory Agency) Abdulkadir Saidu, ló kéde yìí láṣàálẹ́ ọjọ́ Ìsẹ́gun.

English: Saidu stated that the guiding price takes effect from April 1 2020, and shall apply at all retail outlets nationwide for the month of April, 2020.
Yoruba: Sàídù ní àdínkù owó epo ọ̀hún yóò bẹ̀rẹ̀ ní ọjọ́ kíńní, oṣù kẹrin, Ọdún 2020 (April 1 2020), gbogbo ilé-iṣẹ́ tí wọ́n gbé ń ta epo ọkọ̀ ayọ́kẹ́lẹ́ ní jákè-jádò orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà ló gbọdọ̀ tẹ̀lé ìfilọ̀ yìí.

English: --- COVID-19 : Àwọn méjìlá míràn tún jẹyọ lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà
Yoruba: --- COVID-19 : Àwọn méjìlá míràn tún jẹyọ lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà

English: The confirmed cases of COVID-19 have risen to 135 in Nigeria.
Yoruba: Àwọn alárùn kòrónà ní Nàìjíríà (COVID-19 ) ti di mọ́kànléláàdọ́jọ ( 151)  lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà báyìí.

English: On its official Twitter handle @NCDCgov, the Nigeria Centre for Disease Control, NCDC, confirmed 4 new cases, 9 in Osun State and 1 in Edo State, 1 in Ekiti
Yoruba: Àjọ tó ń mójútó àjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà tún tikéde lórí ẹ̀ro Twitter wọn  @NCDCgov, , pé àwọn mẹ́sàn án (9) mìíràn tún ti jẹyọ ní ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀sun, méjì (2) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Ẹdó,  ẹyọ kan(1) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Èkìtì.

English: --- COVID-19: President Buhari thanks individuals, companies for support
Yoruba: --- COVID-19: Ààrẹ Buhari dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ àwọn ènìyàn, ilé-iṣẹ́ fún àtìlẹ́yìn

English: President Muhammadu Buhari has acknowledged with deep appreciation, the kind gestures of captains of industries, corporate entities, missionaries, music artistes and individuals who have consistently supported the fight at mitigating the COVID-19 pandemic ravaging the global economy.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari ti fi ìdúpẹ́ àtinúwá rẹ̀ hàn sí ìs̩e rere àwọn olúdarí ilé-iṣẹ́, àwọn ajíhìnrere, àwọn olórin àti ẹnìkọ̀ọ̀kan tó ṣàtìlẹ́yìn fún ìjọba láti gbógun ti àjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn  COVID-19 tó kọlu ètò ọrọ̀ ajé àgbáyé.

English: The President thanked the group of oil companies, who partnered with the Nigerian National Petroleum Cooperation (NNPC) to donate $30 million, while appreciating contributions from the All Progressives Congress National leader, Asiwaju Bola Tinubu, Dr Mike Adenuga, Mrs Folorunsho Alakija of Famfa Oil, and Dr Emeka Offor, who joined a list of other public-spirited Nigerians in contributing health and educational facilities.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ ilé-iṣe tó ń ta epo rọ̀bì to fọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ pẹ̀lú ilé-isẹ́ (NNPC) láti fun won ni ọgbọ́n mílíọ́nù dọ́là, ó tún dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ ọ̀kan lára àgbà ẹgbẹ́ (APC), Asíwájú Bólá Tinubu, Dr Mike Adénúgà, ìyáàfin  Fólórunshó Alákijà tó ti ilé-epo  Famfa , àti Dr Emeka Offor, tí ò darapọ̀ mọ́ àwọn ọmọ Nàìjíríà  láti ṣèrànwọ́ ètò ìlera àti ilé-ẹ̀kọ́.

English: The President also welcomed the generous donations announced by Zenith Bank PLC, which was committed to the public health care system. He welcomed donations also from Keystone bank, First Bank Plc and the Senior Pastor of Dunamis International Gospel Centre, Dr Paul Enenche, and his wife, Dr Becky Enenche.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ tún fi inú dídùn dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ àwọn onínú rere wọ̀nyí, ilé-ìfowópamọ́ Zenith Bank PLC, tí ó pèsè  ìrànwọ́ níbi ètò ìlera. Ààrẹ tún dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ ilé –ìfowópamọ́  Keystone bank, First Bank Plc àti olùdarí ilé-ìjọ́sìn Dunamis International Gospel Centre, Dr Paul Enenche, àti ìyàwó rẹ̀, Dr Becky Enenche.

English: President Buhari equally appreciated the efforts of Stallion Empowerment Initiative of the Stallion Group and the entertainment industry, particularly renowned musician, Innocent Idibia Tuface for their contributions.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ tún dúpẹ́ gidigidi lọ̣́wọ́ ilé-iṣẹ́ Stallion Group àti àjọ̣ tó mójútó ètò ìgbafẹ́ àti ìdárayá pàápàá jùlọ akọrin ìlú mọ̀-ọ́n-ká, Innocent Idibia Tuface fún ìrànlọ́wọ́ wo̩n.

English: Repositioning health care
Yoruba: Ìtúns̩e ètò ìlera

English: The President assured Nigerians that the funds will be properly utilized to fight the spread of COVID-19 and reposition the health care system.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ Buhari wá fi dá gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà lójú pé, àwọn yóò lo owó náà bó se tọ́ láti fi gbogun ti ìtànkálè̩ COVID-19 àti fúntùnúns̩e ilé-ìwòsàn.

English: He urged all intending donors to channel their contributions through the Presidential Task Force for the Control of the Coronavirus (COVID-19).
Yoruba: Ó ro̩ gbogbo afúnni láti fowó náà ráns̩é̩ sí ikò̩ ààre̩ amójútó ààrùn kòrónà (COVID-19).

English: President Buhari urged Nigerians to follow the guidelines provided by the Ministry of Health, State governments and the National Centre for Disease Control (NCDC), whose officials have been toiling day and night to keep everyone in the country safe.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ tún wá rọ̣ àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà kí wó̩n tè̩lé ìlànà tí ilé-is̩é̩ ìlera, ìjo̩ba ìpínlè̩ àti ikò̩ amújótó ààrùn lóríléèdè (NCDC), tí òs̩ìs̩é̩ rè̩ ń s̩is̩é̩ ló̩sàn-án lóru kí gbogbo ènìyàn lórílèèdè le wà ní àlááfíà.

English: He noted that the situation facing the country, and others across the world, would certainly need the financial, technical and material support of companies and individuals, and the collective efforts of Nigerians to bring the pandemic under control.
Yoruba: Ó ní ìpèníjà tí ó ń dojúko̩ orílè̩ èdè wa, àti àwo̩n orílè̩ èdè yòókù lágbàáyé, yóò nílò àtile̩yìn owó, ìrònú ati èròjà látò̩dò̩ ilé-is̩é̩ àti ènìyàn, pè̩lú ìfo̩wó̩sowó̩pò̩ o̩mo̩ Nàìjíríà láti lè kápa ìtànkálè̩ ààrùn kòrónà náà.

English: --- Covid-19: the committee will follow the guidelines before assisting during lockdown
Yoruba: --- Covid-19: Ìgbìmọ̀ yóò tẹ̀lé ìlàna kí wọ́n tó ṣèrànwọ́ lásìkò ìgbélé

English: The secretary General to the federal government, Boss Mustapha has said the committee will soon give the guidelines they will follow to assist.
Yoruba: Akọ̀wé àgbà ti ìjọba àpapọ̀, Boss Mustapha ní ìgbìmọ̀ kò ní pẹ́ s̩e àgbéjáde ètò ìlànà tí wọn yóò tẹ̀lé láti ṣe ìrànwọ́.

English: President Muhammadu Buhari has approved the appointment of committee that will be in charge of the economy in Nigeria, which will be head by the vice president, Yemi Osinbajo.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari ti fọ̣wọ́sí yíyan ìgbìmọ̀ tí yóò máa ṣe àmojútó ètò okòòwò ní orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, ní èyí tí igbákejì ààrẹ, Yemí Òsínbàjò yóò máa darí rẹ̀.

English: The Secretary General to the federal government , Boss Mustpha said this during the inauguration of the committee in Abuja.
Yoruba: Akọ̀wé àgbà fún ìjọba àpapọ̀, Mr Boss Mustapha ló sọ̀rọ̀ eléyìí lásìkò ìfilọ́lẹ̣̀ ti ìgbìmọ̀ náà ní ìlú Àbújá.

English: The Secretary General also said the government appoint the committee to give the less privileged during the lockdown in Abuja, Lagos state and Ogun state so that it can stop the spread of COVID-19 in Nigeria.
Yoruba: Akọ̀wé àgbà náà tún sọ pé ìjọba yan ìgbìmọ̀ ọ̀hún láti lee máa fún àwọn ènìyàn tára ń ni nílùú Àbújá, Èkó àti Ògùn  lásìkò ìgbélé yìí, kí ó lè dẹ́kun ìtànkálẹ̀ ààrùn Covid-19 ní Nàìjíríà.

English: We are just starting, we don’t know when the pandemic will be over, but I believe that we will start the program soon, the program of guidelines.
Yoruba: A ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ bẹ̀rẹ̀ ni, a ò tíì mọ ìgbà tí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ yìí máa tán, sùgbọ́n mo nígbàgbọ́ pé, a ó bẹ̀rẹ̀ ètò náà láìpẹ́, àwọn ètò ìlànà

English: He the committee will soon announce the guidelines they will follow.
Yoruba: Òun, ìgbìmọ̀ náà yóòọ̀ kéde láìpé̩ ìlànà tí wọn yóò tẹ̀lé.

English: --- COVID-19 Lockdown: Governors pledge seamless movement of essential commodities
Yoruba: --- Ìgbélé COVID-19: Àwo̩n Gómìnà s̩èlérí mímójútó ìlo̩kiri e̩rù pàtàkì

English: The Nigeria Governors’ Forum (NGF) has pledged its commitment to ensuring the seamless movement of essential commodities throughout the country during the period of lockdown declared in some states.
Yoruba: Ẹgbẹ́ àwọn gómìnà Nàìjíríà (NGF) ti ṣèlérí pé àwọn yóò mójútó bí àwọn ẹrù tó ṣe pàtàkì yóò ṣe máa lo̩kiri lóríléèdè Nàìjíríà lásìkò ìgbélé láwọn ìpínlẹ̀ kò̩ò̩kan wò̩nyí.

English: The forum made the pledge in a communiqué issued after its first teleconference meeting held on Sunday and signed by the NGF Chairman, Governor Kayode Fayomi of Ekiti State.
Yoruba: Nínú àtẹ̀jáde kan tí ẹgbẹ́ náà kọ pé lásìkò ìpàdé tí wọ́n ṣe lórí ẹ̀rọ ayélujára lọ́jọ́ Àìkú, ní èyí tálága ẹgbẹ́ ọ̀hún, Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Èkìtì, Káyòdé Fáyẹmí fọwọ́ṣí.

English: The communiqué made available to reporters on Monday in Abuja noted that the governors through the teleconference meeting deliberated on the COVID-19 pandemic in the country.
Yoruba: Àtẹ̀jáde ọ̀hún tó te̩ àwọn akò̩ròyìn ló̩wó̩ lójó̩ ajé ní Abuja so̩ pé àwo̩n gómìná s̩èpàdé lórí è̩ro̩ ayélujára, sò̩rò̩ lórí ìtànkálè̩ kòrónà káàkiri orílèèdè Nàìjíríà.

English: The communiqué read in part: “Governors are committed to ensuring that there is seamless movement of essential commodities throughout the country during this period of the lockdown.
Yoruba: Nínú abala àtè̩jáde náà, ó so̩ pé: “àwo̩n gómìnà ti s̩e ìlérí láti rí i dájú pé àwo̩n è̩rù pàtàkì lo̩ káàkiri orílè̩ èdè yìí ní àkókò ìgbélé.

English: “Through the NGF Secretariat, a protocol for the movement of essential services will be developed and shared with all state governments.
Yoruba: Ní Se̩kitáríàtì NGF, òfin gbígbé àwo̩n e̩rù pàtàkì káàkiri yóò jáde wo̩n á sì fi fún gbogbo ìjo̩ba ìpínlè̩ ní orílè̩-èdè.

English: “To strengthen private-sector-led support for the COVID-19 pandemic, the NGF Secretariat will serve as the coordination mechanism by tracking the COVID-19 essential needs of all states including equipment for contact tracing/sample collection, diagnosis and treatment.
Yoruba: E̩gbé̩ tó s̩e àte̩numó̩ ìdí fún fo̩wó̩sowó̩pò̩ láàrin ètò ìlèra ìjo̩ba àpapò̩, àjo̩ amójútó ààrùn ní Nàìjíríà (NCDC) àti àwo̩n ilé-is̩é̩ ní ìpínlè̩ láti kí́n ìgbésè ìdènà ìtànkálè̩ ààrùn náà.

English: The governors also agreed to hold weekly teleconference meetings to receive regular updates from all states and maintain a coordinated response to the pandemic.
Yoruba: Àwọn gómìnà tún fẹnukò láti máa ṣèpàdé pọ̀ lóòrè-kóòrè àti lọ́sẹ̀-ọ̀sẹ̀ lórí ẹ̀rọ̣ ayélujára lórí ààrùn corona àti ìgbésẹ̀ tí wọn ń gbé lórí rẹ̀.

English: Fayemi briefed the governors on various state-level coordination with the Presidential Task Force on COVID-19 and the private sector through the Food, Beverages and Pharmaceuticals Association led by the Manufacturers Association of Nigeria (MAN).
Yoruba: Fáyemí sọ fún àwọn gómìnà nípa ìgbésẹ̀ tÍkò̩ ìjọba àpapọ̀ amójútó ààrùn Korona ń gbé àti àwọn ilé-iṣẹ́ aládàáni, nípasè̩ ìpèsè oúnje̩, ohun mímú àti e̩gbé̩ olóògùn èyí té̩gbé̩ a-sohun-títà ti Nàìjíríà (MAN) darí.

English: The other private sector bodies included the MTN Foundation and the donor group led by Aliko Dangote and Herbert Wigwe.
Yoruba: Àwo̩n Ilé-iṣẹ́ aládàáni yòókù ni MTN Foundation àti àwo̩n e̩gbé̩ a-fi-nǹkan lè̩ èyí tí Aliko Dangote àti Herbert Wigwe darí.

English: The communique stated that the governors also received an update from the Minister of Health, Dr Osagie Ehanire, and the Director-General of the NCDC, Dr Chikwe Ihekweazu, on the Federal Government’s efforts to stop the spread of COVID-19.
Yoruba: Àtẹ̀jáde náà ní àwo̩n gómìnà tún gba ìròyìn láìpé̩ láti ò̩do̩ mínísítà fún ètò ìlera, Dr Osagie Ehanire, àti olùdarí àjọ NCDC, Dr Chikwe Ihekweazu, lórí ìgbésẹ̀ tí ìjọba àpapọ̀ ń gbé láti dẹ́kun ìtànkálè̩ ààrùn COVID-19 lórílèèdè.

English: It added that the duo also updated the governors on plans to increase the capacity of states to improve testing and care for COVID-19 cases.
Yoruba: Ó fikún-un pé àwo̩n méjéèjì fún àwo̩n gómìnà níròyìn lóòrèkóòrè lórí ètò láti mú ibi àyè̩wò àti ìtó̩jú alárùn kòrónà ní àwo̩n ìpínlè̩ gbòòrò si.

English: --- COVID-19: Chief of Staff to President Buhari speaks on his status
Yoruba: --- COVID-19: Olùdarí òs̩ìs̩é fún Ààre̩ Bùhárí sò̩rò̩ lórí ipò rè̩

English: The Chief of Staff to President Buhari, Abba Kyari, says he feels well but will be transferred to Lagos for additional tests and observation following his testing positive to COVID-19.
Yoruba: Olùdarí òṣìṣẹ́ fún ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, Abba Kyari, ti ní kò sí ohun tó ṣe ìlera òun sùgbọ́n òun yóò lọ fún àyẹ̀wò ààrùn Corona mìíràn ní ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó.

English: The chief of Staff who disclosed this Sunday via twitter @NGRPresident said he made his own care arrangements to avoid further burdening the health system that is already under much pressure.
Yoruba: Adarí ọ̀ún sọ̀rọ̀ lọ́jọ́ Àìkú lórí ẹ̀rọ twitter rẹ @NGRPresident sọ pé òun ti ṣètò ìtọ́jú fún ara òun láti leè dín wàhálà àwọn òṣ̣ìṣ̣ẹ́ elétò ìlera tí wó̩n bò kù.

English: “I have made my own care arrangements to avoid further burdening the public health system, which faces so many pressures,” Kyari said.
Yoruba: “Mo ní àwo̩n alábòójútó tèmi nítorí àtilè dín wàhálà èto ìlera ìlú kù, tí wó̩n ń kojú ìpèníjà,” Kyari ló so̩ èyí.

English: Kyari said he has feels well and has neither experienced high fever nor other symptoms associated with the virus.
Yoruba: Kyari ní ara òun balè̩ àti pé òun kò ní ìrírí gbígbóná àti àwo̩n ohun àìléra mìíràn tó rò̩ mó̩ àrùn ò̩hún.

English: “Like many others that will also test positive, I have not experienced high fever or other symptoms associated this new virus and have been working from home.
Yoruba: “Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ènìyàn tó jé̩ alárùn kòrónà, èmi kò tíì ní ìrírí ìgbónára tàbí àwọn ohun àìléra mííràn tó níí ṣe pẹ̀lú ààrùn Corona.

English: I hope to be back at my desk very soon.
Yoruba: Mo ń ṣe iṣẹ́ mi láti ilé, mo sì ní ìrètí pé màá tètè padà sẹ́nuuṣ̣ẹ́.

English: I have a team of young, professional, knowledgeable and patriotic colleagues, whose dedication has been beyond the call of duty, who continue to work seven days a week, with no time of the day spared.
Yoruba: Mo láwọn ọ̀dọ́ , onímò̩,  ọló̩gbó̩n àti afìfé̩s̩is̩é̩ alábàás̩is̩é̩pò̩ , tí wọ́n sì ń  s̩iṣẹ́ lọ́jọ́ méje láàrín ọ̀sẹ̀ , tí kò sọjọ́ kan fún ìsinmi.

English: We will continue to serve the president and people of Nigeria, as we have for the past five years,” Kyari added.
Yoruba: A ó tún tẹ̀síwájú bí a ti ń ṣe láti bí ọdún márùnún sẹ́yìn láti máa sin ààrẹ àti àwọn ènìyàn orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà.” Kyari s̩àfikún.

English: Statement by Chief of Staff to the President, on his health status:
Yoruba: Ò̩rò̩ láti e̩nu Olùdarí àwo̩n òs̩ìs̩é̩ ti Ààre̩, nípa ipò ìlera rè̩:

English: He’s stable & feels well —Transferring to Lagos for additional tests & observation — “I have made my own care arrangements to avoid further burdening the public health system, which faces so many pressures.”
Yoruba: Ara rè̩ balè̩ o sì wàpa– Lílo̩ sí Èkó fún àyè̩wò àti ìtó̩jú si – “Mo ní àwo̩n alábòójútó tèmi nítorí àtilè dín wàhálà èto ìlera ìlú kù, ti wó̩n ń kojú ìpèníjà.”

English: He thanked health workers who are working across the country who put their lives on the line for the citizens of Nigeria. He also praised Nigerians for looking out for the vulnerable in their midst.
Yoruba: Ó tún dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ àwọn òṣ̣ìṣ̣ẹ́ elétò ìlera tó ń s̩is̩é̩ jákè-jádò Nàìjíríà, tí wọ́n ń fẹ̀mí ara wọn wéwu fún o̩mo̩ Nàìjíríà gbogbo. Ó tún gbós̩ùbà fun ọmọ Nàìjíríà nítorí ìtọ́jú tí wọn fun aláìní.

English: Kyari appealed for calm while advising Nigerians to observe proper hygiene, listen to advice from good authorities, ignore fake news and obey instructions on social distancing.
Yoruba: Kyari ro̩ o̩mo̩ Nàìjíríà fún sùúrù nígbà ìgbaninímò̩ràn lórí ìmó̩tótó ara, gbigba ìmò̩ràn rere látò̩dò̩ àwo̩n adarí, ko̩tíikún sí àwo̩n ìròyìn oníró̩ àti títèlé ìtó̩só̩nà ìjìnnà-síra-e̩ni.

English: --- COVID-19: those that tested positive for corona virus in Nigeria are now one hundred and eleven (111)
Yoruba: --- COVID-19: Àwọn tí wón s̩àyèwò fún tó sì ní ààrun corona ni Nàìjíríà ti di mọ́kànléláàdọ́fà (111)

English: Center for disease control in Nigeria (NCDC) has announced that another fourteen people have tested positive for corona virus (COVID-19) in Nigeria. Nine (9) from Lagos state and five (5) from the federal capital territory, Abuja.
Yoruba: Ilé- iṣẹ́ tó ń gbógun ti àjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn (NCDC) lórílèèdè Nàìjíríà ti kéde pé àwọn mẹ́rìnlá mìíràn ti ní ààrùn Corona (COVID-19) lórílèèdè yìí. Àwọ̣n mẹ́sàn án ní ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó àti márùn ún ní FCT, Àbújá.

English: From half past nine (9:30) on 29th those that have corona virus are one hundred and eleven, with one death, but Lagos state is still leading with sixty (68) people infected.
Yoruba: Láti aago mẹ́sàn-án ààbọ̀, lọjọ́ kọkàndínlọ́gbọ̀n, àwọn tó ní ààrùn Corona ti di mọ́kànléláàdọ́fà, ò̩kán kú, s̩ùgbó̩n ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó ló sì ń gbégbá orókè báyìí pẹ̀lú alárùn ènìyàn tó jẹ́ méjìdínláàdọ́rín.

English: --- COVID-19: President Buhari orders lockdown of Lagos, Ogun and FCT
Yoruba: --- COVID-19:Àar̀ẹ Buhari pàsẹ pé kí wọ́n ti Èkó, Ògùn àti Àbújá (FCT) pa

English: In a bid to contain the spread of the novel coronavirus also known as COVID-19, the Nigerian President, Muhammadu Buhari has ordered the total lockdown of Lagos State, Ogun State and the Federal Capital Territory.
Yoruba: Lọ́nà àti dẹ́kun ààrùn Corona , tí a mọ̀ ṣí COVID-19 , ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, Muhammadu Buhari ti pàsẹ pé kí ó máa sì wíwọlé tàbí jíjáde  yálà àwọn ènìyàn tàbí ọkọ̀ nílùú Èkó , Ògùn àti Àbújá.

English: The President, who gave the order in a nationwide broadcast on Sunday evening, stated that the lockdown would take effect from 11pm on the 30th of March 2020.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lásìkò tó ń se ìgbóhùnsáfẹ́fẹ́, lááṣáálẹ́ ọjọ́ Àìkú, pé òfin wíwọlé tàbí jíjáde  yóò bẹ̀rẹ̀ ní aago mọ́kànlá, ọgbọ̀ọjọ́, oṣù kẹta, ọdún 2020.

English: “Based on the advice of the Federal Ministry of Health and the NCDC, I am directing the cessation of all movements in Lagos and the FCT for an initial period of 14 days with effect from 11pm on Monday, 30th March 2020.
Yoruba: Nípa ìmọ̀ràn láti ọ̀dọ̀ àwọn àjọ tó ń mójútó ètò ìlera àti àjọ tó ń mójútó gbígbógun ti ààrùn lórílẹ́ èdè Nàìjíríà, nítorí náà mo pàṣẹ, pé kó ní sí wíwọlé tàbí jíjáde nílùú Èkó, Ògùn àti FCT Àbújá fún odidi ọjọ́ mẹ́rìnlá gbáko bẹ̀rẹ̀ láti  aago mọ́kànlá, ọgbọ̀ọjọ́, oṣù kẹta,ọdún 2020.

English: This restriction will also apply to Ogun State due to its close proximity to Lagos and the high traffic between the two States”.
Yoruba: Ohun tó fàá ti ìpínlẹ̀ Ògùn ni pé ìpínlẹ̀ náà súnmọ́ ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó àti bí àwọn ọkọ̀ ṣe pọ̀ ní àwọn ìpínlẹ̀ méjèèjì náà.

English: “All citizens in these areas are to stay in their homes. Travel to or from other states should be postponed.
Yoruba: Gbogbo àwọ̣n tó wà ní àwọn ìpínlẹ̀ wọ̀nyí gbọ́dọ̀ wà nínú ìgbélé. Kò ní sí ètò ìrìnnà láti ìpínlẹ̀ kan ṣí èkejì.

English: All businesses and offices within these locations should be fully closed during this period,” he stated.
Yoruba: Gbogbo ilé-iṣẹ́ àti ọ́fíísì tó wà ní àwọn agbègbè yìí gbọ́dọ̀ wà ní títì pa lásìkò yìí.

English: President Buhari noted that Governors of Lagos and Ogun States as well as the Minister of the FCT have been notified.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ Buhari ní àwọn gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó, Ògùn àti mínísítà ìlú Àbújá ti mọ̣̀ nípa ìgbélé yìí.

English: “Furthermore, heads of security and intelligence agencies have also been briefed”.
Yoruba: Bákan náà, gbogbo àwọn adarí ilé-iṣẹ́ elétò ààbò àti ìtọpinipin ti mọ̀ nípa ètò ọ̀hún.

English: He said his administration would use the containment period to identify, trace and isolate all individuals that have come into contact with confirmed cases.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ ní ìjọba òun yóò lo àsìkò ìgbélé ọ̣̀hún láti ṣe ìtọpinpin àwọ̣n tí wọ́n ti ṣalábàápàdé àwọn tó ní ààrùn Korona náà.

English: The Nigerian leader added that the order does not apply to hospitals and all related medical establishments as well as organisations in health care related manufacturing and distribution.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ ní òfin náà kò mú àwọn ilé-ìwòsàn àti àwọn elétò ìlera àti ilé-iṣẹ́ epo àti pín egbòogi òyìnbó.

English: “Furthermore, commercial establishments such as; food processing, distribution and retail companies; petroleum distribution and retail entities, power generation, transmission and distribution companies; and private security companies are also exempted” he clarified.
Yoruba: Bákan náà, gbogbo àwọn ilé-iṣẹ́ tó ń pèṣè àti àwọn tó ń ta ouńjẹ, ilé-epo rọ̀bì àti ilé-iṣẹ́ tó ń ta epo ọkọ̀ ayọ́kẹ́lẹ́, ilé-iṣẹ́ mọ̀nà-mọ́ná àti ilé-iṣẹ́ aládàáni alámòójútó ètò ààbò.

English: He added that although the above mentioned establishments are exempted, access will be restricted and monitored.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ ní bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé òfin ètò ìgbélé kò mú àwọn ilé-iṣẹ́ wọ̀nyí síbẹ̀ ètò yóò wà nípa ibi tí wọn leè lọ.

English: “Workers in telecommunication companies, broadcasters, print and electronic media staff who can prove they are unable to work from home are also exempted”.
Yoruba: Àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ ilé-iṣẹ́ tó ń mójútó ẹ̀rọ ìbáraẹni-sọ̀rọ̀ àti ìpè, ilé-iṣẹ́ ìròyìn yálà rédíò, móhùn-máwòrán tábi lórí ẹ̀rọ ayélujára tí kò bá leè ṣe iṣẹ́ láti ilé rẹ̀, ni wọn yóò gbà láàyè láti rìn, sùgbọ́n irúfẹ́ àwọn ènìyàn báyìí gbọdọ̀ leè fi káàdì ìdánimọ̀ wọn hàn.

English: --- We have 60-days fuel sufficiency – NNPC
Yoruba: --- O̩gọ́ta ọjọ́ lepo lè dé -NNPC

English: Nigerian National petroleum Corporation (NNPC) has urged Nigerians not to engage in panic buying of Premium Motor Spirit (PMS), as the country has adequate stock of the products to last for over 60-days.
Yoruba: Ilé–iṣẹ́ a-tepo-rọ̀bì lórílẹ̀èdè Nàìjíríà (NNPC) ti rọ àwọn ọmọ Nàìjíríà láti máa ṣe bẹ̀rù nípa ríra epo ayọ́kẹ́lẹ́, nítorí pé ilé-iṣẹ́ náà ni epo tí Nàìjíríà leè lò fún oṣù méjì gbáko.

English: Mr Mele Kyari, Group Managing Director of the corporation, gave the assurance while briefing newsmen on Sunday in Abuja.
Yoruba: Ọ̀gbẹ́ni Mele Kyari, tó jẹ́ aláákóso ilé –iṣẹ́ ọ̀hún, ló sọ ọ̀rọ̀ ìdánilójú lásìkò tó bá àwon akọ̀ròyìn sọ̀rọ̀ lọ́jọ́ Àìkú, nílùú Àbújá.

English: Kyari assured that the NNPC had the support of all stakeholders to ensure adequate supply of petroleum products in the country.
Yoruba: Kyari wá rọ̣ gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà láti yàgò fún títò lẹ́sẹsẹ nílé- ìtajà epo, bí omíyalé.

English: He said: “There is absolutely no scarcity anywhere; our supply is robust, we have fuel that will last this country even for 60-days if assuming we do not import any.
Yoruba: Ó ní: “kò sí àìní níbì Kankan; o̩ja wa kún, a ní epo tí yóò tó orílèèdè fún os̩ù méjì láì repo.

English: “Of course people because of the pandemic, stay at home, may try to conserve fuel, there is no need to do this.
Yoruba: “Lóòótó̩, è̩yin ènìyàn, nítorí ìtànkálè̩ ààrùn, a dúró sílé, e lè gbìyànjú láti s̩e epo kù, e kò nílò láti s̩e èyí.

English: He appealed to Nigerians not to flood fuel stations as there was no need for that.
Yoruba: Ó ro̩ àwo̩n o̩mo̩ Nàìjíríà láti má bo ilé-epo gbogbo nítorí kò sí ìdí fún èyí.

English: Commenting on National Association of Road Transport Owners (NARTO) order to petrol tankers drivers to vacate the depots, Kyari said that the corporation would continue to engage them.
Yoruba: Sísò̩rò̩ lóri às̩e̩ NARTO fún àwo̩n oló̩kò̩ agbépo kí wó̩n kúrò nísò̩ wo̩n, Kyari ní ilé-is̩é̩ ò̩hún a túnbò̩ máa rán wó̩n káàkiri.

English: “No restrictions; as we speak now loading is going on, trucks are moving around, no action like that will come to fruition,’’ he added.
Yoruba: Ó tè̩síwájú pé, "Bí a ṣe ń sọ̀rọ̀ báyìí, kò sí ìdíwọ́ fún àwọn awakọ̀ epo ọkọ̀ ayọ́kẹ́lẹ́, nítorí pé wọ́n rí epo wọn gbà déédé, kò sí nínú èròǹgbà ilé –iṣẹ́, láti dá iṣẹ́ dúró".

English: --- President Buhari to address Nigerians on Sunday
Yoruba: --- Ààre̩ Buhari yóò bá Nàìjíríà sò̩rò̩ ní Súńńdè

English: President Muhammadu Buhari will broadcast to the nation today Sunday, March 29 at 7pm local time.
Yoruba: Ààre̩ Muhammadu Buhari yóò bá o̩mo̩ Nàìjíríà sò̩rò̩ lónìí Súnńdè, March 29 ní aago méje alé̩.

English: Special Adviser to the President on Media and Publicity, Femi Adesina disclosed this in a statement.
Yoruba: Olùgbanímò̩ràn sí Ààre̩ orílèèdè Nàìjíríà ti Ìròyìn àti ìpolongo, Fé̩mi Adés̩ìnà so̩ èyí nínú ò̩rò̩ rè̩.

English: He advised television, radio and other electronic media outlets to hook up to the network services of the Nigerian Television Authority (NTA) and Federal Radio Corporation of Nigeria (FRCN) for the broadcast.
Yoruba: O gba àwo̩n ilé-is̩é̩ telifís̩àn, àti ilé-is̩é̩ rédíò pè̩lú ò̩nà ìsò̩rò̩yìn mìíràn níyànjú láti darapò̩ mó̩ Ilé-is̩é̩ Telifís̩àn àkó̩kó̩ (NTA) àti Ilé-is̩é̩ Rédíò Àpapò̩ ti Nàìjíríà (FRCN) fún ò̩rò̩ Ààre̩ ò̩hún.

English: Voice of Nigeria would also be live tweeting on our Twitter handle @voiceofnigeria.
Yoruba: Ohun Nàìjíríà yóò máa já geere ní ààyè lóri è̩ro̩ Twitter wa @voiceofnigeria.

English: -- COVID-19: Ekiti Governor orders lockdown, shuts borders
Yoruba: --- COVID-19: Gómìnà Èkìtì pàsẹ ìgbélé, ti gbogbo e̩nuubodè

English: Governor Kayode Fayemi of Ekiti on Sunday announced a lockdown in the state, directing residents to stay at home from Monday.
Yoruba: Gómìnà Káyòdé Fáyemí ti kéde lọ́jọ́ Àìkú pé wọ̣n yóò ti ìpínlẹ̀ Èkìtì pa, kí ó le dẹ́kun ìtànkalẹ̀ ààrun Korona.

English: The governor in a broadcast imposed a ban on all commercial activities as well as intra state travels, except for those bordering on essential services.
Yoruba: Gómìnà nínú ò̩rò̩ rè̩, pàs̩e̩ kí gbogbo okòwò gbogbo dúró gbo̩in bákan náà ni ti ìrìnàjò yòówù, àfi àwo̩n tó ń lokiri nítorí o̩jà pàtàkì.

English: He said that anyone that violated the latest measures aimed at checking further spread of the coronavirus pandemic in the state, risked a six-month jail term.
Yoruba: Ó ní eni tí ó bá tàpá ṣi òfin tuntun ọ̀hún tí ó wà láti dé̩kun ìtànkálè̩ kòrónà ní ìpínlè̩ náà yóò fẹ̀wọ̀n oṣ̣ù mẹ́fà júra.

English: The governor expressed regrets that past measures adopted by him to curtail the virus were being brazenly ignored.
Yoruba: Gómìnà fàìdùnnú rè̩ hàn sáwo̩n ìgbésè̩ ìs̩áájú láti kápá ààrùn yìí s̩ùgbó̩n àwo̩n ènìyàn mò̩-ó̩n-ò̩n ketí ikún si.

English: He said: ”It is very disappointing that some of us have either been lukewarm, nonchalant or downright defiant in observing the simple but extremely effective preventive measures as well as maintaining social distancing to protect themselves from infection and curtail the spread of the virus in their communities.
Yoruba: O ní: “ó s̩eni láàánú gidgidi pé ìs̩esí àwo̩n kan tutu, àì-kobi-ara-si tàbí fífojú té̩ḿbé̩lú pípa àwo̩n ìlànà tí ó ro̩rùn àmó̩ tó kójú òs̩ùnwò̩n kíkápá kòrónà àti ìjìnnà sí ara e̩ni láwùjo̩ láti lè dáàbòbò ara wo̩n àti s̩e àdínkù ìtànkálè̩ àrùn náà ní àwo̩n ìgbéríkó wo̩n.”

English: ” While I acknowledge our resilient nature, incurable optimism and spiritual activism as a people, it is critical that we balance these with pragmatic and urgent actions that can ensure the safety of lives for our families and communities
Yoruba: “Bí mo s̩e mo̩ rírí ìfàyàrán wa, ìrètí tí ò le ye̩ àti ìdúrós̩ins̩in nínú è̩mí gé̩gé̩ bi ènìyàn, ó s̩e pàtàkì ká dó̩gba èyí pè̩lú ìrònú àti ìgbésè̩ kíákíá tó lè dáàbòbò è̩mí e̩bí àti ìgbéríko wa.

English: ” If we do not take steps necessary to contain this virus, it has the potential to overwhelm our health infrastructure, cripple our economy and devastate Ekiti in unimaginable proportions.
Yoruba: ”Tá ò bá gbégbèésẹ̀ tó ye̩ láti dẹ́kun ààrùn yìí, ó s̩eés̩e kó borí ilé-iṣẹ́ ètò ìlera wa, ṣètò ọrọ̀ ajé wa níjàm̀bá, kí ó sì ìjàm̀bá púpọ̀ bá Èkìtì.

English: ” As you are aware, the state is under significant financial constraints especially as a direct consequence of the impact of the coronavirus on the global economy and the price of crude oil that has gone down considerably.
Yoruba: “Gé̩gé̩ bí a s̩e mo̩, ipò tí ìpínlè̩ yìí wa kò dára nítorí owó pò̩ lápò ìlú, èyí ti ipa ààrùn kòrónà kó níbè̩ àti sí o̩rò̩ ajé lágbàáyé pè̩lú owó epo rò̩bì tó ti lo̩lè̩ gan-an.

English: ” So, we cannot afford a public health crisis.
Yoruba: “Nítorí náà, a kò le fààyè àìléra láwùjo̩.

English: ” It is therefore in urgent public interest that, I hereby, in pursuant to Section 8 of the Quarantine Act, Laws of the Federation of Nigeria 2004 and the Constitution of the Federal Republic of Nigeria 1999 (as amended) impose a curfew of movement in Ekiti .
Yoruba: “Ìdí nìyí tí ó jé̩ àkíyèsí pàtàkì láwùjo̩ pé, nípasè̩ ojú ewé 8 ti ìs̩e ìsénimó̩lé, ofin ìjo̩ba àpapò̩ Nàìjíríà, o̩dún 2004 àti ìwé òfin ìjo̩ba àpapò̩ ti Nàìjíríà, o̩dún 1999 (pè̩lú àtúns̩e) so̩ ìgbélé láìrí ènìyàn kan tí ó ń rìnkiri di kànńpá ní ìpínlè̩ Èkìtì.

English: ”The purpose of this curfew is to impose restrictions on the movement of persons and goods within Ekiti for an initial period of 14 days.
Yoruba: “Ìdí fún ìgbélé náà ni láti dẹ́kun bí wọn yóò ṣe máa kó àwọn ènìyàn àti ẹrù láàrín ìpínlẹ̀ ọ̀hún fún odidi ọjọ́ mẹ́rìnlá gbáko.

English: ”Therefore, effective from 1:59pm on Monday, March 30, 2020 until 11:59pm on Monday, April 13, 2020, there shall be restriction of movement across the length and breadth of Ekiti, with all our borders closed.
Yoruba: “Nítorí náà, láti 1:59pm ló̩sàn-án lọ́jọ́ Ajé, March 30, 2020 dé 11:59pm lálé̩ lójọ́ Ajé, April 13, 2020, ènìyàn kankan kò gbọdọ̀ rìnkiri ní Èkìtì, kí gbogbo e̩nuubodè náà ṣì wà ní títì pa.

English: ”That is a full and total shutdown of Ekiti, and a 12-hour dusk to dawn curfew in Ekiti  from 7:00pm – 7:00 am.
Yoruba: “Èyí ni ìsémó̩lé pátápátá ní ìpínlè̩ Èkìtì, àti ìgbélé fún wákàtí méjìlá láti aago méje alẹ́ titi di aago méje òwúrọ̀.

English: All Ekiti residents are hereby directed to stay at home
Yoruba: Gbogbo o̩mo̩ ìpínlè̩ Èkìtì ní a rò̩ láti dúró sílé wo̩n.

English: ”We are implementing the Quarantine Act to keep all Ekiti residents safe. So let me be clear.
Yoruba: “À ń s̩àmúlò ìs̩e ìsénimó̩lé láti dáàbòbò gbogbo o̩mo̩ ìlú Èkìtì. Nítorí náà, e̩ jé̩ só̩ kó yé yékéyéké.

English: If you do not go home or stay home for at least 14 days as from Monday, 30 March, 2020, you can face serious fines or prison term.
Yoruba: Tí o kò bá lo̩ tàbí dúró sílé fún o̩jó̩ mé̩rìnlá bè̩rè̩ ló̩jó̩ ajé, 30 March, 2020, o lè sanwó ìtanràn re̩pe̩te̩ tàbí fè̩wò̩n júra.

English: ”During this period, movement between local governments areas is prohibited; movement between towns, villages and communities is also prohibited; every person shall be confined to the place where he or she ordinarily resides in Ekiti,” he said.
Yoruba: Ó ní, “Lásìkò ìgbélé ọ̀hún, lílọ sí ìjọba ìbílẹ̀síbìílẹ̀, ìlúsíìlú, ìletò sí letò ti di èèwọ̀ ní ìpínlẹ̀ Èkìtì; Bákan náà, gbogbo àwọn tó bá wà ní ìpínlẹ̀ Èkìtì lásìkò ìgbà náà, ni ètò ìgbélé náà mú.”

English: He emphasised that all businesses and other entities should cease operations during this period except those involved in the provision of essential goods or services.
Yoruba: Ó tún sọ pé gbogbo ilé-iṣẹ́ ni kó wà ní títì pa, àyàfi àwọn tó bá ń ṣe isẹ́ tó nííṣe pẹ̀lú ẹ̀mí àwọn ènìyàn.

English: ”Markets, retail shops and shopping malls must be closed, except where essential goods are sold and with strict hygienic conditions to prevent the exposure of persons to COVID-19.
Yoruba: Àwọn ọjà, ilé –ìtajà ńlá àti kékeré ló gbọ́dọ̀ wà ní títìpa àyàfi ibi ì-ta-o̩jà-pàtàkì, wọ́n sì gbọdọ̀ wà ní ìmọ́tótó káàrùn COVID-19 má tàn mó̩ àwo̩n ènìyàn.

English: ”Religious gatherings like worship and prayer services, night vigils, house fellowships and NASFAT meetings; social gatherings like  funerals, weddings, family meetings and parties of any kind in night clubs, bars, beer joints; and political gatherings like. rallies, congresses, ward meetings, all of these are prohibited activities under these regulations.
Yoruba: Gbogbo ilé ìjọ́sìn, bí i ibi àdúrà òun ìyìn, ìsọ́-òru, ìdàpò̩ ojúlé, àti ìpàdé NASFAT; àpéjo̩pò̩ ènìyàn bíi ayẹyẹ okú, ìgbéyàwó, ìpàdé ẹbí àti ilé-ijó, ilé-ọtí, ìpàdé òṣèlú, ìwọ́de, ìpàdé ẹgbẹ́ wọ́ọ̀dù àti àwọn ìpàdé àti ètò ayẹyẹ  lóríṣiríísi ni ó ti di èèwọ̀ báyìí pẹ̀lú ètò ìlànà yìí.

English: ”Only gathering in respect of funeral will be allowed but the attendance shall be limited to 20 persons with no night vigil or party.
Yoruba: Ìpéjopọ̀ bíi ìsìnkú nìkan ni a ò gbà láàyè, sùgbọ́n ìpéjọpọ̀ náà kò gbọdọ̀ ju ènìyàn ogún lọ, kò gbọdọ̀ sí ìṣọ́-òru tàbí ayẹyẹ.

English: ”All boundaries of Ekiti are closed during this period, except for transportation of fuel, food and drugs and other essential goods.
Yoruba: Gbogbo enubodè Èkìtì ni yóò wà ní títìpa lásìkò yìí àyàfi awakọ̀ epo rọ̀bì, àwọn olóúnjẹ, egbòogi òyìnbó àtàwọn ọjà aṣepàtàkì.

English: ”All non-residents who arrive the state prior to, or after, the imposition of this restriction, and who remain in the state, must remain in their place of temporary residence in the state for the duration of the 14 days, as the case may be, and may be subjected to screening for COVID-19 and be quarantined or isolated if necessary.
Yoruba: Gbogbo àwọn tí kìí ṣe ọmọ ìpínlẹ̀ Èkìtì sùgbọ́n tí wọ́n dé sí ìpínlẹ̀ náà lásìkò tàbí lẹ́yìn òfin ìgbélé náà gbọdọ̀ wà níbi tí wọ́n ń gbé ní ìpínlẹ̀ ọ̀hún fún ọjọ́ mẹ́rìnlá ìkéde náà, wọn yóò sì tún ṣàyẹ̀wò ààrùn COVID-19, bákan náà ní wọn yóò tún wà ní ìgbélé, tí ó bá jẹ́ dandan fún wọn.

English: ”All commuter transport services including bus services, taxi services, motor bikes (Okada) and tricycle services, are prohibited; except those for purposes of rendering essential services, obtaining essential goods, seeking medical attention, funeral services and to receive payment of social grants or food
Yoruba: “Gbogbo àwo̩n awakò̩ bíi bó̩ò̩sì, ayó̩ké̩lé, ò̩kadà àti kè̩ké̩ márúwá, ni kò gbo̩dò̩ s̩is̩é̩; àfi àwo̩n tí ó ń jáde nítorí is̩é̩e̩ kò̩s̩émás̩e, yí wó̩n ń gbà e̩rù pàtàkì, wíwá ìtó̩jú, aye̩ye̩ òkú àti gbígba owó ìrànwó̩ fun oúnje̩ àbí ohun mìíràn.

English: ”Only those who are performing essential services will be allowed to move around, particularly health workers, but must be duly designated with an identity card by the head of their institutions.
Yoruba: Àwo̩n tó bá ń s̩e is̩é̩ pàtàkì ní wo̩n yóò fún láyè látì máa lokiri, pàápàá jùlo̩ àwo̩n òs̩ìs̩é̩ ètò ìlera, s̩ùgbó̩n olóri ilé-is̩é̩ wo̩n gbo̩dò̩ fún wo̩n ní káàdì ìdánimò̩.

English: Fayemi clarified that only few category of individuals and institutions providing certain critical services were  exempted from the restrictions:
Yoruba: Fáye̩mí s̩àlàyé pé àwo̩n tófin ìgbélé ò mú kò ju àwo̩n ènìyàn kò̩ò̩kan àtilé-is̩é̩ tó ń pèsè ohun pàtàkì:

English: They include members of the state Executive, Legislature and the Judiciary;
Yoruba: Àwọn ni ọmọ ilé – ìgbìmọ̀ aṣojú, ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ àti ilé-ẹjọ́.

English: The list also included persons in production, distribution and marketing of food and beverages, pharmaceuticals, medicine, paper and plastic packages, environmental and sanitation activities, staff of electricity, water, telecommunications, e-commerce and digital service providers.
Yoruba: Àwọn mìíràn ni olùs̩e, olùpín àti olùta ouńjẹ àti ohun mímu, ilé-ìtajà egbòogi òyìnbó, ilé –ìtàwé àti abọ́, alámòjútó àyíká àti ìmọ́tótó, òṣìṣẹ́ mọ̀nà-mọ́ná, omi, ilé-ìbára-ẹni-sọ̀rọ̀, ilé-iṣẹ́ òǹtajà lóri ẹ̀rọ ayélujára àtàwọn olùpèsè ẹ̀rọ ayélujára.

English: The rest were members of security agencies assigned on lawful duties; staff of banks and similar financial institutions and staff of fuel stations.
Yoruba: Àwọn mìíràn ní òṣìṣẹ́ elétò ààbò tí wó̩n gbés̩é̩ fún, òṣìṣẹ́ àwo̩n ilé-ìfowópamọ́, èyí tí ó jo̩ ó̩ àti òṣìṣẹ́ àwo̩n ilé-epo rọ̀bì.

English: ”Any person who contravenes these regulations shall be guilty of an offence and, on conviction, liable to a fine or to imprisonment for a period not exceeding six months or to both  fine and imprisonment,”  the governor said.
Yoruba: Gómìnà ní, “e̩ni tó bá rúfin yìí yóò jè̩bi è̩sun náà, nígbà tí wó̩n bà sì dalé̩bi, ó lè sanwó ìtanràn tàbí lo̩ è̩wò̩n tí ò tó os̩ù mé̩fà tàbí sanwó ìtanràn kó sì lo̩ è̩wò̩n bákan náà”.

English: Fayemi, who said he was aware of the negative consequences of the new development on businesses and families, said palliatives were being worked out for residents, especially high risk and vulnerable citizens.
Yoruba: Fáyemí, ní òun mọ̀ pé ìgbésẹ̀ yìí yóò mú ìníra dání fún okòwò àti mò̩lé̩bí, ó sì ní ohun ìrànwó ń lo̩ ló̩wó̩ fún àwo̩n ọ̣mọ ìpínlẹ̀ Èkìtì, pàápàá jùlọ àwọn abarapá.

English: --- COVID-19: Nigeria’s confirmed cases rise to 97
Yoruba: --- COVID-19: Mé̩tàdínló̩gò̩rún lálàrún kòrónà dì ní Nàìjíríà

English: Nigeria’s confirmed cases of the novel coronavirus COVID-19 has risen to 97.
Yoruba: Ó ti di ènìyàn mẹ́tàdínlọ́gọ́rùn tó ti ní ààrùn Corona báyìí ní Nàìjíríà.

English: Confirming the latest eight cases, the Nigeria Centre for Disease Control explained that “As at 10:40 pm 28th March there are 97 confirmed cases of #COVID19 reported in Nigeria with 1 death”.
Yoruba: Àjọ agbógunti ààrùn ló kéde àwọn mẹ́jọ tó tún ṣ̣ẹ̀ṣẹ̀ jẹyọ pé “ní déédé 10:40am lóòórò̩, 28th, March làwọn àlárùn Korona lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí ti di mẹ́tàdínlọ́gọ́rùn, ò̩kan sì ti kú.

English: “Currently; Lagos- 59 FCT- 16 Ogun- 3 Enugu- 2 Ekiti- 1 Oyo- 7 Edo- 2 Bauchi- 2 Osun-2 Rivers-1 Benue- 1 Kaduna- 1”
Yoruba: “Báyìí; Èkó- 59, FCT - 16 Ògùn- 3 Enugu- 2 Èkìtì- 1 Oyo- 7 Edo- 2 Bauchi- 2 Òṣun-2 Rivers-1 Benue- 1 Kaduna- 1”

English: Eight new cases of #COVID19 have been reported in Nigeria; 2 in FCT, 4 in Oyo, 1 in Kaduna and 1 in Osun State
Yoruba: Àwo̩n alárùn kòrónà mé̩jo̩ tún ti je̩yo̩ lórílè̩ èdè Nàìjíríà; 2 ní FCT, 4 ní Ò̩yó̩, 1 ní Kàdúná àti 1 ní ìpínlè̩ Ò̩s̩un

English: As at 10:40 pm 28th March there are 97 confirmed cases of #COVID19 reported in Nigeria with 1 death.
Yoruba: Ní déédé 10:40am lóòórò̩, 28th, March làwọn àlárùn Korona lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí ti di mẹ́tàdínlọ́gọ́rùn, ò̩kan sì ti kú.

English: --- COVID-19: Nigerian President orders closure of air, land borders
Yoruba: --- COVID-19: Ààrẹ Nàìjíríà pàs̩e̩ títi pápá o̩kò̩ òfurufú àti e̩nuubodè

English: In a bid to curtail the spread of the deadly Coronavirus, the Nigerian President, Muhammadu Buhari has directed the immediate closure of Nigeria’s International Airports and Land Borders for four weeks.
Yoruba: Láti dẹ́kun ìtànkálè̩ ààrùn as̩ekúpani kòrónà, ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, Muhammadu Buhari  ti pàṣẹ títi pápá ọkọ̀ òfurufú ilẹ̀ òkèèrè ní Nàìjíríà àti e̩nuubodè ní kíákíá fún ọ̀sẹ̀ mẹ́rin gbáko.

English: The President who made this known via his official Twitter handle @MBuhari on Thursday night, noted that the move was to enable the Government “put up the appropriate policies, processes and infrastructure to cope with suspected and confirmed cases at home, without risking a compounding of the situation with more imported cases”.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ so̩ èyí lórí Twitter rẹ @MBuhari lálé̩ o̩jó̩bò̩, ó ní ìgbésè̩ náà wà láti ran ìjo̩ba ló̩wó̩ nípa fífi gbogbo ìlànà tó ye̩, ìgbésè̩ ló̩ló̩kan-ò-jò̩kan, ohun amáyéde̩rùn láti lè kápá alárùn afunrasí àti èyí tí a ti s̩àwárí ní ilé, láì mu burú sí i pè̩lú èyí tó ń tòkèèrè wá.

English: The President however regretted the inconvenience caused by flight and travel restrictions to Nigerians abroad who want to return home adding that “it is necessary for the greater good, and I thank you all for your understanding and cooperation”.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ fàìdùnnú hàn sí ìnira tí títí pápá ọkọ̀ òfúrufú àti e̩nuubodè ti fún àwọn ọmọ Nàìjíríà tó fé̩ wálé, ó sì fi kún un pé “ó pondandan fún àǹfààní wa, mo dúpé̩ fún ìfọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ àti ìgbó̩niye gbogbo yín.

English: “I have also directed that only cargo vessels that have been at sea for more than 14 days be allowed to dock in our ports, after the crew have been tested and confirmed disease-free by the Port Health Authorities”.
Yoruba: Mo ti pàṣẹ pé ọkọ̀ ojú –omi e̩lé̩rù, o̩ló̩jó̩ mé̩rìnlá ó lé, lórí òkun nìkan, ni yóò dé sí ibùdókò wo̩n, lẹ́yìn tí àjọ elétò ìlera tolómi bá ti ṣàyẹ̀wò fún ikò̩ ọ̀hún tí wó̩n sì rárìídájú pé wo̩n ò lárùn.

English: “This 14-day restriction however does not apply to vessels carrying oil and gas products as by their nature, there is minimal human contact,” he explained.
Yoruba: Ó s̩àlàyé pé, “ìgbélé o̩jó̩ - mé̩rìnlá yìí kò níí s̩e pè̩lú àwo̩n tó ń gbé epo rò̩bì àti afé̩fé̩ gáàsì níwò̩n tí ìfarakínra pè̩lú ènìyàn kéré.

English: President Buhari also suspended the movement of commuter trains to limit the spread of the virus to other parts of the country.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ Buhari tún dá ìlo̩kiri ọkọ̀ ojú-irin dúró láti lè s̩e àdínkù ìtànkálè̩ ààrùn náà sí è̩yà tí ó kù ní orílè̩-èdè.

English: Intervention Fund President Buhari also ordered the immediate release of a 10 billion Naira grant to Lagos State, which he said remains the epicentre of the Covid-19 outbreak in Nigeria.
Yoruba: Owó ìrànwọ́ – Ààre̩ Buhari tún pàṣẹ kí wọ́n yò̩nǹda owó ìrànwó̩ bílíọ̣́nù mẹ́wàá náírà fún ìpínlè̩ Èkó, nítorí ibè̩ ni ibùdó ìtànkálè̩ Kòrónà ní Nàìjíríà, gé̩gé̩ bí ó s̩e so̩.

English: “This grant will enable Lagos increase its capacity to control and contain the outbreak, while also supporting other States with capacity-building,” he explained.
Yoruba: Owó ìrànró̩ yìí máa mú Èkó láàyè sí láti kápá àti dènà ìtànkálè̩, yóò sì tún ránpìnlé̩ yòókù ló̩wó̩ nípa kíkó̩lé gbígbóòrò, ó s̩àlàyé.

English: The President also ordered the immediate release of a 5 billion Naira special intervention fund to the Nigeria Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) to “equip, expand and provide personnel to its facilities and laboratories across the country”.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ tún wá pa às̩ẹ yíyó̩ǹda bílíọ́nù márùn-ùn owó ìrànwó̩ tí wó̩n ya só̩tò̩ fún àjo̩ amójúto ìtànkálè̩ ààrun (NCDC) fún ríra irinsẹ́, ìmúgbòòrò àti wíwá kún àwo̩n òs̩ìs̩é̩ sí ilé-is̩é̩ àti àwo̩n ibi-àyè̩wò wo jákèjádò orílè̩-èdè.

English: “I have directed the NCDC to draft all its recent retirees back into service to beef up our manpower as we respond to the pandemic”.
Yoruba: “Mo ti pàs̩e̩ kí NCDC pé gbogbo òs̩ìs̩é̩ fè̩yìntì láìpé̩ padà sí e̩nuus̩é̩ láti lè kín àwo̩n òs̩ìs̩é̩ wa ló̩wó̩ ní ìfèsì sí ìtànkálè̩ náà”.

English: “Furthermore, all NCDC staff and experts who are away on training or international assignments are to return immediately,” he directed.
Yoruba: Síwájú sí i, gbogbo àwo̩n òs̩ìs̩é̩ NCDC tó wà lé̩nu ìkó̩s̩é̩ àti lé̩nu is̩é̩ lókè òkun padà wá sílé ní kíákíá.

English: Effective Response Nigerian President noted that the Nigerian Air Force is already making its fleet available to the Presidential Task Force on Covid-19, to enable a better coordinated and more effective response across the country.
Yoruba: Fún ìjáfáfá nínú is̩é̩ yìí, ààre̩ Nàìjíríà ní ikò̩ òfurufú ológun ti Nàìjíríà (NAF) ti ń s̩ètò àwo̩n o̩kò̩ wo̩n fún ikò̩ ààre̩ amójútó kòrónà, láti lè s̩àmúlò káàkiri orílè̩-èdè fún àmójútó tó yè kooro.

English: “Already the Nigerian Air Force (NAF) is conducting an evacuation mission to bring back some of our specialists in Central Africa, to enable them support the national response,” he added.
Yoruba: “Ló̩wó̩ló̩wó̩, ikò̩ òfurufú ológùn Nàìjíríà (NAF) ń gbégbèésè̩ láti kó àwo̩n onímò̩ ìjìnlè̩ wa tó wà ní Central Africa wálé, láti fo̩wó̩ kún ètò tó ń lo̩ ló̩wó̩ló̩wó̩”, ó fikún-un.

English: Fiscal Measures He commended the monetary policy authorities for their financial intervention to support entrepreneurs and companies as the country goes through “this difficult time”.
Yoruba: Ètò ìnáwó – “Ó gbóríyìn fún àwo̩n è̩ka tó ń mójútó owó fún ìrànló̩wó̩ tí wó̩n s̩e fún àwo̩n ilé-is̩é̩ aládàáni ”ní irú àkókò líle yìí”.

English: The President noted that the government is also looking at fiscal measures to minimise the negative impact of this pandemic on the livelihood of millions of Nigerians.
Yoruba: Ààre̩ ní ìjo̩ba yóò wá ò̩nà láti pèsè owó ìtura fún aráàlú láti lè dín ipa búburú tí àjàkálè̩ yìí s̩e ní ìgbé-ayé ogunló̩gò̩ o̩mo̩ orílè̩-èdè Nàìjíríà.

English: “As you are aware we have begun the process of reviewing the federal budget. We shall communicate our fiscal interventions once the budget review process is concluded”.
Yoruba: Gé̩gé̩ bí e̩ s̩e mò pé ìgbésè̩ lórí àtúnyè̩wò ètò ìsúnná lóríléèdè ti bè̩rè̩. E̩ máa gbàbò̩ ò̩nà àbáyo̩ gbàrà tí àtúnyè̩wò ètò ìsúnná bá ti parí.

English: “In the meantime, I have directed the Minister of Industry, Trade and Investment, to work with the Manufacturers Association of Nigeria (MAN), to ensure that all production of essential items such as food, medical and pharmaceutical products continues unhindered”.
Yoruba: Ní àkókò yìí, mo ti pàs̩e̩ fún Mínísítà alábòójútó ilé-is̩é̩ ìs̩òwò àti ìdókòwò, láti s̩is̩é̩ pè̩lú e̩gbé̩ olùs̩e-ohun-títà ti Nàìjíríà (MAN), láti rí i dájú pé pípèsè ohun pàtàkì bí i oúnje̩, onírúurú òògùn ń tè̩síwájú láì sí ìdíwó̩.

English: Knowledge & Support President Buhari stated that the government was already engaging international friends and partners to share knowledge and to seek their support in response to the pandemic.
Yoruba: Ìmò̩ àti àtile̩yìn – Ààre̩ Buhari so̩ pé ìjo̩ba òun ti ń tàkurò̩so̩ pè̩lú ò̩ré̩ àti alábàás̩e òkèèrè láti pín ìmò̩ àti gbígba ìrànwó wo̩n lórí ìtànkálè̩ ààrùn yìí.

English: “We are grateful for the show of support thus far – we have already started receiving goods and supplies intended to help us scale up our efforts”.
Yoruba: “A mo̩yì yín lórí àtìle̩yìn tí a ti rí gbà báyìí – A ti ń gba àwo̩n e̩rù kò̩ò̩kan tí ó wà fún ríran ìgbìyànjú wa ló̩wó̩”.

English: “Let me specially thank and commend all of the hard and heroic work being done by our medical personnel, the NCDC, Port Health Authorities, Security Agencies, State Governments, and all ad-hoc staff and volunteers”.
Yoruba: “E̩ jé̩ n fi tò̩wò̩tò̩wò̩ dúpé̩ pè̩lú gbígbóríyìn fún is̩é̩ ako̩ni òun ribiribi tí òs̩ìs̩é̩ ìlera, NCDC, òs̩ìs̩é̩ ìlera olómi, àjo̩ elétò ààbò, ìjo̩ba ìpínlè̩, àti gbogbo òs̩ìs̩é̩ àrà pè̩lú òs̩ìs̩é̩ ò̩fé̩ ti s̩e”.

English: Panic & Misinformation President Buhari urged all Nigerians to be mindful of those who seek to spread panic and misinformation, and sow confusion at this time.
Yoruba: Ìjayà àti Ìròyìn àhésọ - Ààrẹ Buhari rọ̣ àwọn ọmọ Nàìjíríà láti sọ́ra fún àwọn tó fẹ́ dá ìpayà àti àhéso̩ sílẹ̀ láti fàpòrúúru lásìkò yìí.

English: “We must all pay attention only to the relevant government agencies working day and night to make accurate and useful information available to the public”.
Yoruba: “A gbó̩dò̩ té̩tí sí ohun pàtàkì tí àwo̩n as̩ojù-ìjo̩ba tí ó s̩is̩é̩ ló̩sàn-án lóru láti lè mú ìròyìn tí ó tè̩wò̩n fún arááyé gbó̩”.

English: “I will also ask all of us to strictly obey all public health guidelines and instructions issued by the Federal and State health authorities, regarding personal hygiene and social distancing”.
Yoruba: “Mo máa tún ro̩ gbogbo wa láti tè̩lé gbogbo ìlànà àti ìtó̩só̩nà ìlera tí ìjo̩ba àpapò̩ àti ìjo̩ba ìpínlè̩ làkalè̩ lórí ìmó̩tótó ara àti jíjìnnà sí ènìyàn nílé àti lóko.

English: “These guidelines will be updated from time to time as new information and treatments are obtained”.
Yoruba: “Àtúnṣe a máa je̩yo̩ lórí àwọn ìlànà wò̩nyí lóòrèkóòrè, bímọ̀ràn àtìtọ́jú tuntun bá s̩e ń wo̩lé.

English: “In the meantime, I want to assure all Nigerians that the Federal Government remains committed to protecting all Nigerians.
Yoruba: “Ní báyìí, mo fé̩ fi dá gbogbo o̩mo̩ orílè̩-èdè Nàìjíríà lójú pé, ìjo̩ba àpapò̩ kò kè̩rè̩ láti dáàbò bò yín.

English: We seek your full support and cooperation as we go through this very difficult time.
Yoruba: A nílò àtìle̩yìn àti ìfo̩wó̩sowó̩pò̩ yín lásìkò àìdè̩rùn yìí.

English: Together we will triumph over this pandemic”.
Yoruba: Bí a bá fo̩wó̩sowó̩pò̩, ó dájú pé a ó borí ààrùn yìí”.

English: --- COVID-19: Nigeria confirms 14 new cases
Yoruba: --- COVID-19: Nàìjíríà tún s̩àwárí ènìyàn mẹ́rìnlá

English: The Nigeria Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) has confirmed 14 new cases of the novel coronavirus also known as COVID-19.
Yoruba: Àjọ amójútó ààrùn kòrónà lórílèèdè Nàìjíríà (NCDC) tún ti s̩àwárí ènìyàn alárùn kòrónà mẹ́rìnlá tí a tún mọ̀ sí COVID-19.

English: Confirming the cases via its official Twitter handle, the NCDC noted that  one of the cases was confirmed in FCT, one in Bauchi and 12 in Lagos,
Yoruba: Àjọ NCDC ló gbé èyí jáde lòrì ẹ̀rọ Twitter wọn pé, wó̩n rí alárùn Kòrónà kan ní FCT, ẹyọ kan ní Bauchi àti méjìlá ni ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó.

English: “Of the 14, six were detected on a vessel, three are returning travellers and two are close contacts of confirmed cases,” the NCDC explained.
Yoruba: “Nínú mé̩rìnlá, wó̩n s̩àwárí mé̩fà lórí omi, mé̩ta jé̩ arìnrìnàjò tó ń padàbò̩ àti méjì tó súnmó̩ ara wo̩n ni wó̩n s̩àwárí”, NCDC s̩àlàyé.

English: This brings the total number of confirmed cases in Nigeria to 65, with three discharged and one death.
Yoruba: Èyí mú gbogbo alárùn kòrónà as̩àwárí ní Nàìjíríà jé̩ márùndínláàdọ́rin, pè̩lú mé̩ta tí wó̩n fiílè̩, ò̩kan sì papòdà.

English: We noticed an error in our update at 8:35pm. It should be:
Yoruba: A rí às̩ìs̩e nínú ìròyìn wan í 8:35pm, ó ye̩ kó jé̩:

English: 14 new cases of #COVID19 have been confirmed in Nigeria: 1 in FCT, 1 IN BAUCHI & 12 in Lagos
Yoruba: Wó̩n s̩e àwárí alárùn kòrónà mé̩rìnlá ní Nàìjíríà; ò̩kan ní FCT, ò̩kan náà ní Bauchi àti méjìlá ní ìlú Èkó.

English: Of the 14, 6 were detected on a vessel, 3 are returning travellers & 2 are close contacts of confirmed cases pic.twitter.com/Pe6owiXBKB — NCDC (@NCDCgov) March 26, 2020
Yoruba: Nínú mé̩rìnlá, wó̩n s̩àwárí mé̩fà lórí omi, mé̩ta - arìnrìnàjò tó ń padàbò̩ àti méjì tó súnmó̩ ara wo̩n ni wó̩n s̩àwárí  – NCDC (@NCDCgov) March 26,2020.

English: --- COVID-19: VP Osinbajo tests negative
Yoruba: --- COVID-19: Igbákejì ààrẹ, Ọ̀sínbàjò kò láàrùn Kòrónà

English: Nigeria’s Vice President, Prof. Yemi Osinbajo, has tested negative to the coronavirus.
Yoruba: Igbákejì ààrẹ Nàìjíríà, ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n Yemí Ọ̀sínbàjò, ti yege àyẹ̀wò ààrùn Kòrónà.

English: This followed tests conducted to check his status.
Yoruba: Èyí hàn nínú àyẹ̀wò tí wọ́n ṣe fúngbàkejì ààrẹ.

English: Spokesman to the Vice President, Laolu Akande, confirmed this in response to enquiries from the media.
Yoruba: Agbẹnusọ igbákejì ààrẹ, Láolú Àkàndé, ló fi ọ̀rọ̀ ọ̀hún múlẹ̀ lákòókò ìfèsì sí ò̩rò̩ akòrò̩yìn nípaa rẹ̀.

English: In his response, Akande said: “Good morning Sirs and Ma: I have been inundated with calls on whether indeed the VP had undergone a COVID-19 test and the outcome.
Yoruba: Nínú èsì ti Àkàndé gbé jáde, ó ní: “Ẹ káàrọ́ọ̀ ẹ̀yin ọkùnrin àti obìnrin: Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ìpè ni mo ti ń gbà bóyá igbákejì ààrẹ ṣàyẹ̀wò COVID-19 àti èsì àyẹ̀wò ọ̀hún.

English: Yes, he has and the result is negative. An official tweet would follow. Thanks”
Yoruba: Bẹ́ẹ̀ni, igbákejì ààrẹ ṣàyẹ̀wò, sùgbọ́n kò ní ààrùn Kòrónà, Ẹ̣ sé”.

English: Akande tweeted on Tuesday that the Vice President had isolated himself and was working from home.
Yoruba: Àkàndé sò̩rò̩ ló̩jò̩ó̩s̩é̩gun lórí Twitter pé igbákejì ààre̩ ti ń dágbé ó sì ń tilé s̩is̩é̩.

English: --- COVID-19: VP Osinbajo goes into self-isolation
Yoruba: --- COVID-19: Igbákejì ààrẹ Òsínbàjò ń dágbé.

English: Nigeria’s Vice President, Prof. Yemi Osinbajo, has gone into self-isolation in keeping with the advice of the National Centre for Disease Control,  NCDC.
Yoruba: Igbákejì ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n Ye̩mí Òsínbàjò ti fi ara rẹ̀ sínú ìgbélé láti tẹ̀lé ìlànà àjọ tó ń sàmójútó ààrùn (NCDC).

English: Spokesman to the Vice President, Laolu Akande, shared this on Tuesday via his twitter handle @akandeoj.
Yoruba: Agbẹnusọ igbákejì ààrẹ, Láolú Àkàndé, ló sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lọ́jọ́ Ìṣẹ́gun láti orí ẹ̀rọ twitter rẹ̀ @akandeoj.

English: Akande said: “VP Osinbajo yesterday (Monday) at the office conducted his meetings via video conferencing while observing social distancing.
Yoruba: Àkàndé ní: “Igbákejì ààrẹ lánàá (Mó̩ńdè) s̩èpàdé nínú ọ́físìì rẹ̀ lórí fídíò akóyànjo̩ láti tè̩lé ìlànà yíye̩ra fún ènìyàn.

English: “Today, he continues his work from the home office, as he is in self-isolation in accordance with NCDC protocols.”
Yoruba: “Ní òní, ó tè̩síwájú nínú is̩é̩ rè̩ láti ilé, nítorí ó wà ní ìgbélé ní ìlànà pè̩lú òfin NCDC”.

English: Akande did not give further explanation about those who might have come into contact with the vice president before he decided to isolate himself.
Yoruba: Àkàndé kó sọ̀rọ̀ lé̩kùnúnré̩ré̩ nípa àwọn tí igbákejì ààrẹ̀ ti s̩e alábàápàdé pè̩lú kí ó tó di pé ó lo̩ ṣe ìgbélé araa rè̩.

English: Vice President Osinbajo yesterday at the office conducted his meetings via video conferencing, while observing social distancing.
Yoruba: Igbákejì ààrẹ Osinbajo lánàá s̩e ìpàdé nínú ọ́físìì rẹ̀ lórí fídíò akóyànjo̩ láti tè̩lé ìlànà yíye̩ra fún ènìyàn.

English: Today, he continues his work from the home office, as he is in self-isolation in accordance with NCDC protocols.
Yoruba: Lónìí, ó tè̩síwájú nínú is̩é̩ rè̩ láti ilé, nítorí ó wà ní ìgbélé ní ìlànà pè̩lú òfin NCDC”.

English: On Monday, Prof Osinbajo was to inaugurate the National Traffic Radio at the headquarters of the Federal Road Saftey Corps, FRSC, Wuse, Abuja.
Yoruba: Ló̩jó̩ ajé, ò̩jò̩gbó̩n Òsínbàjò ye̩ kó s̩e ìfiló̩lè̩ National Traffic Road ní Olú ilé-is̩é̩ àjo̩ amójútó ò̩nà ti ìjo̩ba àpapò̩, FRSC, Wuse, Abuja.

English: It was cancelled, but no official reason was given for the development.
Yoruba: Wó̩n fagi lée, wo̩n ò si so̩ ìdí kan pàtó fúnté̩sìwájú rè̩.
